name: Billy Fury
description:
'''Ronald Wycherley''' (17 April 1940 â€“ 28 January 1983), known professionally as '''Billy Fury''', was an English musician. An early star of [[British rock and roll|rock and roll]], he spent 332 weeks on the UK singles chart. His hit singles include "[[Wondrous Place]]", "[[Halfway to Paradise]]" and "[[Jalousie (Gade)|Jealousy]]". Fury also maintained a film career, notably playing rock performers in ''[[Play It Cool (film)|Play It Cool]]'' in 1962 and ''[[That'll Be the Day (film)|That'll Be the Day]]'' in 1973.

[[AllMusic]] journalist Bruce Eder stated that Fury's "mix of rough-hewn good looks and unassuming masculinity, coupled with an underlying vulnerability, all presented with a good voice and some serious musical talent, helped turn [him] into a major rock and roll star in short order". Others have suggested that his rapid rise to prominence was due to his "[[Elvis Presley|Elvis]]-influenced hip swivelling and, at times, highly suggestive stage act".
